ambition.question: Did my ambition to maintain control and influence over social interactions, especially through digital means, let me prioritize dominance over gentle guidance and humble service in relationships?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

greed.question: Did I make the accumulation of money and possessions a driving force in my life, potentially leading me to idolize material wealth over trust in God's providence?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

greed.question: Have I made accumulation of wealth a driving force in my life, causing me to prioritize material possessions over what is truly valuable?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

greed.question: Did I make wealth and material possessions a driving force in my life?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

envy.question: Have I envied others' accomplishments and secretly wished they would stumble in their endeavors?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and speak to others with vulgar or inappropriate language, violating their dignity?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: to overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what is reasonable
in eating or drinking beyond what is reasonable
gluttony.question: Did you allow your love for food and drink to become excessive, leading you to overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what is reasonable?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, especially when it comes to enjoying meals with friends or family during leisure activities such as socializing, reading, or watching documentaries?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: over essential financial obligations or family needs
prodigality.question: Have I excessively risked my resources for entertainment, prioritizing leisure activities over essential financial obligations or family needs?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

prodigality.question: Have I excessively devoted time and resources to leisure activities at the expense of my financial obligations and family needs?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing others' faults or private affairs, even if what I shared was true, through conversations with friends or acquaintances?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing others' personal matters, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: for purposes other than rest , worship , and relaxation
impiety.question: Did I use Sunday for purposes other than rest, worship, and relaxation?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).
